title: Pittsburgh police investigate two Hill District shootings
content:
One man was killed and three others were injured in two shootings this afternoon in the Hill District, Pittsburgh police said.
City public safety spokeswoman Sonya Toler said one man died in an alley near the scene of a shooting on Dinwiddie Street near Reed and Wick streets that occurred about 5:20 p.m. The Allegheny County medical examiner's office identified him as Christopher Richardson, 20, of West Oakland. He was shot in the torso, Ms. Toler said.
Mr. Richardson was driving a silver Volvo sedan with two other men inside when it was struck by several bullets, Ms. Toler said. The vehicle's front passenger-side window had been shot out, she said.
About the same time, officers found a man outside in the 200 block of Burrows Street with injuries to his lower back that Ms. Toler said were possibly caused by fragments from a separate shooting. Zone 2 police are investigating that incident.
Two of the wounded men were taken to UPMC Mercy, and the other was taken to UPMC Presbyterian. Ms. Toler did not know their conditions. Police have not said what led up to the shootings.
Large crowds gathered as police were collecting evidence and inspecting the Volvo. At one point, Aaron Myrick, 21, of Carrick tried to cross the crime scene tape and ignored officers' commands to stay back, Ms. Toler said. One officer was knocked to the ground and another used a Taser on Mr. Myrick, who was arrested and taken to the Allegheny County Jail.
First Published April 5, 2015 6:49 PM
